content:
As I finished my meal, I felt my eyes start to droop. I was tired, and my body felt worn out. Clarke noticed and looked at me with concern.

"Madi, are you okay? You look tired," she asked, her voice filled with concern.

"I am tired, Clarke," I replied, my voice filled with exhaustion.

Clarke reached out and started petting my hair, her touch soothing and calming.

"Do you want me to sing you a lullaby? It always helped me when I was feeling tired," Clarke asked, her voice filled with kindness.

I softly nodded, my eyes closing as I listened to her singing. I felt my body relax, my mind drifting off. But then, I recognized the lullaby. It was the same lullaby that Lexa had once sung to Clarke and that I had found in Lexa's book back on earth.

"Clarke, this is the lullaby Lexa used to sing to you," I said, my voice filled with emotion.

Clarke nodded, her expression filled with sadness. "Yes, it is. I've kept it with me all these years," she said, her voice filled with regret.

"It's beautiful, Clarke. It brings back so many memories," I said, my voice filled with longing.

Clarke smiled at me, her expression filled with love. "I'm glad you like it, Madi. It's a reminder of the past, but it's also a reminder of the love that Lexa and I shared," she said, her voice filled with understanding.

I nodded, feeling a sense of warmth wash over me. I
